info.description: API for command, control, and automation of a system running Scale Computing HyperCore #### Legend Fields marked with _**DEPRECATED**_ or _**INTERNAL**_ should not be used and may cause unintended side effects. Fields marked with _**CREATE-ONLY**_ cannot be modified after creation. OpenAPI Specification Full JSON Schema Scale Computing RestAPI Examples

name.description: The unique name of the condition.

description.description: A description of the condition which is presentable to the end-user.

value.description:
The boolean value of the condition.  
 True indicates the condition is currently SET.  
 False indicates the condition is currently CLEAR.  
 NOTE:  If the isOK bool is false, this value MUST be ignored.

nodeUUID.description: The UUID of the node this condition refers to.

nodeLANIP.description: The LAN IP address of the node this condition refers to.

modified.description: The time at which this conditions value was last modified, in milliseconds of real time since the UNIX epoch.

userVisible.description: Indicates whether this condition should be made visible to the end user

techNotes.description: Details targeted towards Scale Support team

pollInterval.description: The interval with which the condition is being polled, in milliseconds.

expirationInterval.description: Given no successful polls, this is the interval after which the condition will expire, in milliseconds.

setDelay.description: The interval in milliseconds between the decision function first returning true and when the condition will become SET.

clearDelay.description: The interval in milliseconds between the decision function first returning false and when the condition becoming CLEAR.

lastSetTime.description: The time at which the condition last transitioned from CLEAR to SET, in realtime milliseconds from the UNIX epoch.

lastClearTime.description: The time at which the condition last transitioned from SET to CLEAR, in realtime milliseconds from the UNIX epoch.

guaranteedValidTime.description: The time at which the condition was guaranteed to be valid, in realtime milliseconds from the UNIX epoch.

isExpired.description: Indicates whether the condition has expired.

lastPollFailed.description: Indicates whether the last poll for the condition has failed.

isInitialized.description: Indicates whether the condition has ever been initialized.

isOK.description:
The state of the condition in summary. A value of true implies the condition is not expired,  
 the last poll has not failed, and the condition has been initialized.

VirDomainActionType.description:
State related actions that can be performed on a VM
Name | Description
- | -
START | Start a domain  
 ||  The domain must be in the PAUSED, SHUTOFF, or CRASHED state  
 ||  If _VirDomainActionDescription.nodeUUID_ is specified, the domain is not PAUSED, and the specified node has sufficient resources, the domain will be started on the specified node
 | 
SHUTDOWN | Stop a domain via ACPI shutdown  
 ||  The domain must be in the RUNNING state  
 ||  Note: Windows VMs may ignore ACPI requests
 | 
STOP | Immediately halt a domain  
 ||  The domain must be in the RUNNING, SHUTDOWN, or PAUSED state
 | 
PAUSE | Suspend a domain _**INTERNAL**_
 | 
REBOOT | Reboot a domain via ACPI shutdown  
 ||  The domain must be in the RUNNING state  
 ||  If _VirDomainActionDescription.nodeUUID_ is specified, and the given node has sufficient resources, the domain will be started on that node  
 ||  Note: Windows VMs may ignore ACPI requests
 | 
RESET | Reset a domain immediately without any guest OS shutdown  
 ||  The domain must be in the RUNNING or SHUTDOWN state
 | 
LIVEMIGRATE | Live migrate a running domain to the given node  
 ||  The domain must currently be in the RUNNING state  
 ||  The target node must have sufficient resources to migrate to
 | 
NMI | Send a Non-Maskable Interrupt to the VM  
 ||  The domain must be in the RUNNING state  
 ||  This sends an interrupt to the Virtual CPU that will always run a handler  
 ||  Note: This is generally a diagnostic tool, Check OS documentation for specifics
 |
